Articles.Content:
[Deleted]

**Edited <time datetime="2019-07-18T21:10:25Z" title="07/18/2019 09:10  PM" data-short="4 yr">July 18, 2019</time> by BLSmith2112**

Sorry to say BLSmith2112 but there's nothing in the logs to explain this, I can't see a reason for the slow load times.

I suggest you try a [**clean boot**](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/kb/929135) to eliminate the possibility of other software causing this.

As for the tutorial, that's by design now.

[Deleted]

**Edited <time datetime="2019-07-18T21:10:14Z" title="07/18/2019 09:10  PM" data-short="4 yr">July 18, 2019</time> by BLSmith2112**
There's always the good old fallback. Make sure you have any virtual network adapters disabled, such as Hamachi. It tends to cause Unity to load really slowly.

[Deleted]

**Edited <time datetime="2019-07-18T21:10:02Z" title="07/18/2019 09:10  PM" data-short="4 yr">July 18, 2019</time> by BLSmith2112**

[Deleted]

**Edited <time datetime="2019-07-18T21:09:57Z" title="07/18/2019 09:09  PM" data-short="4 yr">July 18, 2019</time> by BLSmith2112**

Unfortunately not, KSP should be loading *faster* than before thanks to the .dds textures, KSP doesn't need to convert .mbm or .tga to .dds for use by the graphics hardware.

Edit:

Guys, you need to disable any unused network adapters, real or virtual, that will solve the loading times issue.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-04T21:31:08Z" title="05/04/2015 09:31  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 4, 2015</time> by sal\_vager**

[Deleted]

**Edited <time datetime="2019-07-18T21:09:48Z" title="07/18/2019 09:09  PM" data-short="4 yr">July 18, 2019</time> by BLSmith2112**
Just disabling unused adapters should have been enough, I'd check the device manager for any others.

[Deleted]

**Edited <time datetime="2019-07-18T21:09:42Z" title="07/18/2019 09:09  PM" data-short="4 yr">July 18, 2019</time> by BLSmith2112**

[Deleted]

**Edited <time datetime="2019-07-18T21:09:37Z" title="07/18/2019 09:09  PM" data-short="4 yr">July 18, 2019</time> by BLSmith2112**

What about network attached storage?

I found this bug report on the Unity tracker, it looks to be why loading is slow on Windows with unused network adapters.

[**Unity3D bug report January 2014, www-Class for loading local texture is very slow.**](http://answers.unity3d.com/questions/623448/www-class-for-loading-local-texture-is-very-slow.html?sort=oldest)
